title: Netaji's Speeches and Statements The Orient

  physical_appearance: This clipping is a page from the periodical \u0027The Orient Illustrated Weekly\u0027 published on 7 April 1946. The title is printed on the top-left of the page. The text is a printed statement from Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose. There are four black-and-white photographs with captions. The edges of the page are torn
 especially along the right.

  subject_terms_1: speeches (documents) periodicals Indian (South Asian) nationalism

  subject_terms_2: Periodicals Anti-imperialist movements Independence movements National liberation movements Provisional Government of Free India Nationalism Bose
 Subhas Chandra
 1897-1945 self-determination
 national Burma Indian National Army

  subject_terms_3: Indian National Army Monument Site Indian National Army (Singapore) Bose
 Subhas Chandra periodicals

  sgcool_label_text: Prior to the World War II period
 Indians in Singapore and Malaya retained strong political
 sentimental and economic ties with their home country. Anti-colonial thoughts and actions
 inspired by the “call for freedom” in India
 resonated in the region too. Radio broadcasts
 newspaper reports and visits by nationalist leaders strengthened the nationalistic mood among the migrant Indian community. The Indian National Army and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose brought to the fore this spirit of nationalism. This collection provides rare documentary evidence of the involvement of the region\u0027s Indian community in the Indian National Army and the Indian Independence League
 the army\u0027s fund raising arm. This is a group of war time photographs
 newspapers
 magazines and ephemera collected by the sixth president of Singapore
 Mr.S.R.Nathan.

metadata.title_text: Netaji's Speeches and Statements The Orient
metadata.physical_appearance: This clipping is a page from the periodical 'The Orient Illustrated Weekly' published on 7 April 1946. The title is printed on the top-left of the page. The text is a printed statement from Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose. There are four black-and-white photographs with captions. The edges of the page are torn, especially along the right.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Periodicals Anti-imperialist movements Independence movements National liberation movements Provisional Government of Free India Nationalism Bose, Subhas Chandra, 1897-1945 self-determination, national Burma Indian National Army
metadata.subject_terms_3: Indian National Army Monument Site Indian National Army (Singapore) Bose, Subhas Chandra periodicals
metadata.sgcool_label_text: Prior to the World War II period, Indians in Singapore and Malaya retained strong political, sentimental and economic ties with their home country. Anti-colonial thoughts and actions, inspired by the “call for freedom” in India, resonated in the region too. Radio broadcasts, newspaper reports and visits by nationalist leaders strengthened the nationalistic mood among the migrant Indian community. The Indian National Army and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose brought to the fore this spirit of nationalism. This collection provides rare documentary evidence of the involvement of the region's Indian community in the Indian National Army and the Indian Independence League, the army's fund raising arm. This is a group of war time photographs, newspapers, magazines and ephemera collected by the sixth president of Singapore, Mr.S.R.Nathan.
